Ingredients:

  • 1.5 lbs (680g) pork shoulder or belly, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/2 cup vinegar (preferably cane or rice vinegar)
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 onion, sliced
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 teaspoon whole peppercorns
  • 1 tablespoon cooking oil
  • 1 cup water
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

  1. In a bowl, marinate the pork in soy sauce and garlic for at least 30 minutes. You can also marinate it overnight in the refrigerator for more flavor.
  2. Heat the cooking oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Add the marinated pork and cook until browned on all sides.
  3. Add the sliced onion and saut√© until translucent.
  4. Pour in the marinade, vinegar, water, bay leaf, and whole peppercorns. Stir to combine.
  5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and let it simmer for about 1 to 1.5 hours, or until the pork is tender and the flavors are well incorporated. Stir occasionally and add more water if needed.
  6. Once the pork is tender, uncover the pan and continue cooking for a few more minutes to reduce the sauce and thicken it slightly.
  7. Taste the adobo and adjust the seasoning with salt if needed.
  8. Serve the pork adobo hot with steamed rice. You can garnish it with chopped green onions or sprinkle some toasted garlic for added flavor.

Enjoy your delicious pork adobo!
